thread.title: Calaveras oiling up chain saws for Lumberjack Day
thread.title_full: Calaveras oiling up chain saws for Lumberjack Day

author: Christine Delsol
title: Calaveras oiling up chain saws for Lumberjack Day
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 
Axe-throwing and log-cutting competitions rival a parade, food and drink at the Lumberjack Day celebration in tiny West Point, Calaveras County. Photo: Rick Torgerson Axe-throwing and log-cutting competitions rival a parade, food and... Calaveras oiling up chain saws for Lumberjack Day 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
If you’re a small logging town in the foothills somewhere between Sutter Creek and Lake Tahoe, how do you honor your heritage? You might very well celebrate Lumberjack Day, from early in the morning until late at night. That’s just what West Point, off Highway 88 in Calaveras County, has been doing for 41 years. Festivities include a parade, a car show, a rock wall and other activities for kids, vendors, and plenty of food and drink. But all those things are just a warm-up for the serious business of putting big timber, chainsaw and ax-wielding skills to the test. 
Vitals: Oct. 3, 
7 a.m.-10 p.m.; parade at 11 a.m. $5. Main Street and other West Point locations. (209) 293-4259. www.lumberjackday.org. 
Sonoma Music Festival debut: The B.R. Cohn Winery in Glen Ellen is expanding, moving and renaming its annual fall music festival this year. The inaugural Sonoma Music Festival will take place at the Field of Dreams, just north of Sonoma Plaza, with a lineup including Chicago, America, Ringo Starr , Pablo Cruise , the Edgar Winters Band, the Doobie Brothers and Gregg Allman . Oct. 2-4; see website for schedule. $89-$119 general admission, $219-$350 front row and VIP. (888) 810-2063 (info only). www.sonomamusicfestival.com. 
Food lovers return to Capistrano: More than 20 restaurants, bakeries and other food purveyors will fill the arcades of Mission San Juan Capistrano with samples of their varied cuisine for the annual Vintage Food and Wine Festival. Local wineries and breweries will augment the bites, and the ever-popular R&B band Family Style will return for their fifth consecutive year. The chance to see the beautiful old mission at night is just a bonus. Oct. 3, 6-10 p.m. $85. (949) 493-4700. www.vintagesjc.com. Top Stories
